DataElement.preferredName: Bone Stereotactic Body Radiation Therapy Administered Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a yes/no/unknown/not applicable indicator related to the treatment of a disease in the connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Bone Stereotactic Body Radiation Therapy Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the treatment of a disease in the connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.:No value exists.:The entire physical structure of an organism.  It is composed of anatomic systems, regions, cavities, and spaces.:Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Concepts.definition: The structural organ comprised of specialized connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.
The entire physical structure of an organism. It is composed of anatomic systems, regions, cavities, and spaces.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
